กรม|grom|ความกรม|การกรม
column2:
noun
  1. (botany) the plant Aporosa villosa (Wall. ex Lindl.) Baill. of the family Euphorbiaceae.
  2. (archaic and poetic) Alternative form of กรรม (gam)
  3. (archaic) arrangement, order; class, grade, rank; course, way; procedure, process; succession, series.
  4. (archaic) law; ordinance; regulation; rule.
  5. unit of armed men in the government system, commanded by a chief officer called เจ้ากรม (jâao-grom) and a deputy chief officer called ปลัดกรม (bpà-làt-grom). If the chief officer is a royal person, he or she is called เจ้าต่างกรม (jâao-dtàang-grom) and may be given one of the following บรรดาศักดิ์ (ban-daa-sàk, “noble rank”): (from highest to lowest) กรมพระยา (grom-prá-yaa), กรมพระ (grom-má-prá), กรมหลวง (grom-má-lǔuang), กรมขุน (grom-má-kǔn), กรมหมื่น (grom-má-mʉ̀ʉn).
  6. highest governmental department, roughly equivalent to modern-day ministry.
  7. (government) governmental department, often commanded by a chief officer called อธิบดี (à-tí-bɔɔ-dii, “director-general”), subject to กระทรวง (grà-suuang, “ministry”) or ทบวง (tá-buuang, “bureau”), and divided into กอง (gɔɔng, “division”).
  8. (sometimes colloquial) military agency; military base; military unit.

verb

noun
  1. (Buddhism) postulant: person seeking admission into a monastic order.
  2. (botany) beautyleaf, the plant Calophyllum inophyllum L. of the family Clusiaceae (syn. Guttiferae).
  3. elephant.
  4. (mythology) (พญา~, พระยา~) naga; dragon.
  5. (chiefly poetic) snake.

name
  1. Naga: tribesman living near the Naga Hills.

name
  1. (Buddhist mythology) the event during the life of Gautama Buddha, taking place four weeks after he began meditating under the Bodhi Tree, in which a nāga named Mucalinda came up from beneath the earth to protect the Buddha from a prodigious rain with its hood.

noun
  1. (Buddhism) representation of this event, depicting the Buddha sitting in a meditation position with the hood of a nāga over his head.

noun
  1. (mythology, chiefly poetic) any nāga, snake, or dragon; any elephant.

column1: นาคเล่นน้ำ|nâak-lên-náam

column2:
noun
  1. (archaic, now only found in compounds) chief; lord; master.
  2. (somewhat archaic, now sometimes derogatory and offensive) woman.
  3. (archaic) woman in authority, as queen, mistress, lady, etc.
  4. (somewhat archaic, now sometimes derogatory and offensive) used as a title for or term of address to any woman.
  5. (archaic) used as a title for or term of address to a woman in authority, as a queen, mistress, or lady.
  6. (archaic, sometimes derogatory and offensive) used as a title for or term of address to a female commoner, subordinate woman, or woman of lower status.
  7. (historical) used as a formal title for the wife of a nobleman ranking below พระยา (prá-yaa).
  8. (law) a legal title which a married woman may use.
  9. similar title for a married woman, as Mrs.
  10. (slang, humorous) used as a title for or term of address to anyone or anything.
  11. heroine; female protagonist; leading lady.
  12. found in compounds, indicating the feminine gender.

classifier
  1. (somewhat archaic, now sometimes derogatory and offensive) Classifier for women.
  2. (slang, humorous) Classifier for anyone or anything.

noun
  1. (botany) (ว่าน~) Amazon lily: the plant Eucharis × grandiflora of the family Amaryllidaceae, traditionally believed to possess the power to bring luck and fortune.
  2. (occult) idol, image, or statue of a beckoning woman, believed to bring luck and fortune.

noun
  1. (if related to a monarch or monarchy: พระราช~, ราช~) chronological account of historical events: chronicle, annals, etc.
  2. (obsolete) branch of knowledge dealing with past events.
  3. (obsolete) aggregate of past events
  4. (obsolete) historical fiction.

name
  1. (biblical) Chronicles: either of two books of the Old Testament.

noun
  1. (informal) Initialism of พนักงาน (pá-nák-ngaan, “one responsible for a duty or function”).

noun
  1. (elegant) hill; mountain.
  2. thing similar to a hill, mountain, or lotus bud, especially in terms of shape or appearance: heap, pile, etc.

verb
  1. to cause to look like a hill, mountain, or lotus bud, such as พนมมือ (pá-nom mʉʉ; literally "to pá-nom hands"), meaning to press hand palms together in a salute fashion.

name
  1. (อำเภอ~) Phanom District, a district of Surat Thani Province.

noun
  1. (archaic) duty; function.
  2. one responsible for a duty or function, as agent, functionary, officer, official, etc. Abbreviation: พนง. (pɔɔ-nɔɔ-ngɔɔ)

column1: พนักงานขาย|pá-nák-ngaan-kǎai
column2:
noun
  1. member of an organisation or establishment whose duty is to sell something, such as sales agent, sales executive, sales assistant, shopworker, etc.

column2:
verb
  1. (archaic) to support, to aid, to assist; to take care (of), to look after; to guard, to protect.
  2. to medically nurse, tend, or care; to heal, cure, or treat.

noun
  1. (archaic) supporter, aider, assistant; caretaker, care provider; guardian, protector.
  2. medical nursing, tending, or care; healing, cure, treatment.
  3. nurse.

column1: พยายาม|การพยายาม|ความพยายาม|pá-yaa-yaam
column2:
verb

  2. (criminal law) to attempt: to make a substantial but unsuccessful effort (to commit a crime).

noun
  1. (criminal law) attempt: substantial but unsuccessful effort (to commit a crime).

column1: พยุง|pá-yung|การพยุง

adv

noun
  1. (archaic, poetic) a procession (of a line or body of persons, animals, vehicles, etc.).

verb
  1. (archaic, poetic) to move in a procession.

noun
  1. (if intended for a god, high priest, or royal person: พระ~) good wish; blessing; benediction.
  2. (figuratively) boon, gift, godsend; bliss.

noun
  1. (archaic) edge; edging.
  2. (classifier ผืน) carpet, rug, or similar material, as tapestry, etc.
  3. (ไหม~) woolen yarn.
  4. (botany) conkerberry: the plant Carissa spinarum of the family Apocynaceae.
  5. (zoology) the freshwater fish Thynnichthys thynnoides of the family Cyprinidae.

verb
  1. (of liquid) to sprinkle.

noun
  1. border (between states, territories, etc).
  2. (figuratively) edge, boundary; limit.

noun
  1. group, band, or company (of people).
  2. side, part: one of two or more contesting groups, parties, etc.
  3. (colloquial) kind, type, or class (of people).
  4. (colloquial) Clipping of พรรคการเมือง (pák-gaan-mʉʉang, “political party”).

column1: พรรคการเมือง|pák-gaan-mʉʉang
พรรคฝ่ายค้าน|pák-fàai-káan

column2:
verb
  1. to depict, to describe; to explain, to expound.

noun
  1. (medicine and archaic) lump of dry, hard stool; fecal impaction.

noun
  1. (elegant) rainy season; wet season.
  2. Lenten season: the period of three months during the rainy season, usually from July to October, during which priests are required to remain in one place.
  3. tenure of a priest, often expressed in years.
  4. (of a god, high priest, or royal person) (พระ~) year of age; age.
  5. (elegant) year.
  6. (figuratively) experience; seniority.

name
  1. (Hinduism) (พระ~) Brahma, one of the supreme gods, the creator of the universe, often depicted with four heads and four arms and seen sitting on a lotus or riding on a swan.

noun
  1. (Buddhism) (พระ~) brahma, a kind of divine beings that dwell in the realm พรหมโลก (prom-má-lôok), divided into two sub-realms: (1) รูปพรหม (rûup-bpà-prom), for brahmas that have form; and (2) อรูปพรหม (à-rûup-bpà-prom), for formless brahmas.
  2. (Buddhism in Thailand) (พระ~) brahma, a title for priests holding the rank of เจ้าคณะรอง (jâao-ká-ná-rɔɔng).

name
  1. (Buddhism) the name of the four virtues that are practiced by brahmas and that one who wants be as pure as a brahma should practice, that is, เมตตา (mêet-dtaa, “benevolence”), กรุณา (gà-rú-naa, “compassion”), มุทิตา (“empathetic joy”), and อุเบกขา (“equanimity”).

column1: พรอวิเดนซ์|prɔɔ-wí-dén

column2:
noun
  1. god, deity; priest, royal person; also used as an honorific or term of address.
  2. representation, as image, statue, sculpture, etc, of such person.
  3. used as an honorific for or term of address to anyone or anything relating to a god, deity, priest, or royal person, or to a representation of such person.
  4. (historical) the Thai noble rank above หลวง (lǔuang) and below พระยา (prá-yaa); holder of this rank.
  5. male protagonist, as in a literary work, drama, etc.

column1: พระกิตติคุณ|prá-gìt-dtì-kun

column2:
noun
  1. (very formal) favour; kindness.
  2. (humble and archaic) a title for or term of address to a man of rank or in authority, as a nobleman, public officer, etc.
  3. (humble) a title for or term of address to a priest.

noun
  1. (of a god, high priest, or royal person) heart; mind; emotion, feeling, thought, spirit; intention, will, desire, wish.

noun
  1. kingdom; monarchy.
  2. capital city of a kingdom.

name
  1. (historical) the formal name of Bangkok, the capital city of Thailand, from 1865 until 22 December 1971, on which it was consolidated with the province of ธนบุรี to form a polity called นครหลวง (ná-kɔɔn-lǔuang).
  2. (historical) Angkor (the capital city of the Khmer Empire, in modern-day Cambodia)

column1: พระนครศรีอยุธยา|prá-ná-kɔɔn-sǐi-à-yút-tá-yaa|พระนครศรีอยุทธยา
column2:
name
  1. Ayodhya (an ancient city in India)
  2. Ayutthaya, an ancient kingdom in Thailand.
  3. any of its successors which took the same name, including Thon Buri and Rattanakosin.
  4. Bangkok as the capital city of Rattanakosin.
  5. (จังหวัด~) Phra Nakhon Si Ayutthaya, a province of Thailand.
  6. (อำเภอ~) Phra Nakhon Si Ayutthaya, the capital district of such province.

column1: พระพุทธเจ้า|prá-pút-tá-jâao
column2:
noun
  1. any of a series of teachers in Buddhism, of whom Gautama Buddha was the last.
  2. any person who has attained enlightenment.
  3. (Buddhism) Buddha image.
  4. king: male monarch.

name
  1. (Buddhism) Gautama Buddha.

column1: พระพุทธเจ้าข้า|prá-pút-tá-jâao-kâa
column2:
particle
  1. (formal, royal, men's speech) a particle used to express affirmation or assent or to politely end any expression, employed by a male when addressing a high-ranking royal person.

noun
  1. (archaic) chief, lord, master, leader; ruler, administrator, person in authority, person in charge; person of dignity, person of rank, exalted person; monarch, sovereign; royal person; also used as an honorific.
  2. (historical) the Thai noble rank above พระ (prá) and below เจ้าพระยา (jâao-prá-yaa); holder of this rank.

column1: พระยาประเทศราช|prá-yaa-bprà-têet-sà-râat

column1: พระราชกฤษฎีกา|prá-râat-chá-grìt-sà-dii-gaa|chà-bàp|ฉบับ
column2:
noun
  1. (archaic) any law, regulation, command, or edict given by a royal person.
  2. (historical) command, edict, or decree of a queen.
  3. (Thailand law) royal decree: decree issued by the monarch by virtue of a legal provision, probably first used on 10 December 1932 when the first constitution was enacted. Abbreviation: พ.ร.ฎ. (pɔɔ-rɔɔ-dɔɔ).

column1: พระราชกำหนด|ฉบับ|prá-râat-chá-gam-nòt|chà-bàp
column2:
noun
  1. (archaic) any law, regulation, command, or edict given by a royal person.
  2. (Thailand law) emergency decree: law enacted by the monarch upon advice of the executive branch in case of emergency, having the same force as an act of parliament; probably first used on 10 December 1932 when the first constitution was enacted. Abbreviation: พ.ร.ก. (pɔɔ-rɔɔ-gɔɔ).
  3. similar enactment in a monarchical country; that in a republic or other state than a monarchy is called รัฐกำหนด

column1: พระราชทาน|prá-râat-chá-taan|การพระราชทาน
column2:
verb
  1. (royal) to give.
  2. (royal) to permit.

noun
  1. (royal) gift: act of giving, thing given.
  2. (royal) permission.

adj
  1. (royal) royally given.
  2. (royal) royally permitted.

column1: พระราชบัญญัติ|ฉบับ|prá-râat-chá-ban-yàt|chà-bàp
column2:
noun
  1. (archaic) law, regulation, command, or edict given by a royal person.
  2. (Thailand law) act of parliament, probably first used on 27 June 1932 when an interim charter was enacted following the overthrow of the absolute monarchy. Abbreviation: พ.ร.บ. (pɔɔ-rɔɔ-bɔɔ).
  3. act of parliament in a monarchical country; that in a republic or other state than a monarchy is called รัฐบัญญัติ (rát-tà-ban-yàt).
  4. (biblical) law or regulation given by the God.

name
  1. (biblical) Deuteronomy: the fifth book of the Old Testament.

column1: พระราชสมภารเจ้า|prá-râat-chá-sǒm-paa-rá-jâao

  1. second-person pronoun used by priests when addressing kings or queens.

classifier
  1. Classifier for gods, religious personages, high priests, royal persons. ⇒ all nouns using this classifier

noun

  2. an honorific for or term of address to a god, religious personage, high priest, or royal person.

pron
  1. a second or third person pronoun referring to a god, religious personage, high priest, or royal person.

column1: พระองค์เจ้า|prá-ong-jâao
column2:
noun
  1. a child of a king whose mother holds the rank of เจ้าจอมมารดา;
  2. a grandchild of a king whose mother holds the rank of พระองค์เจ้า;
  3. a child of a prince that holds the rank of พระองค์เจ้า and his wife who also holds the rank of พระองค์เจ้า;
  4. a grandchild of a king whose mother is a commoner or holds the rank of หม่อมเจ้า (mɔ̀m-jâao);
  5. a commoner who is made royal by a king.
  6. person holding such rank.
  7. (somewhat archaic) an honorific for or term of address to a god, religious personage, high priest, or royal person.

noun
  1. (classifier พระองค์, องค์, or, archaically, ตน) person who has achieved a state of perfect enlightenment.
  2. (classifier พระองค์ or องค์) representation, as image, statue, etc, of a buddha.
  3. (classifier พระองค์ or องค์) high god.
  4. (classifier พระองค์, องค์, or, archaically, ตน) priest.
  5. (classifier พระองค์, องค์, or, archaically, ตน) male monarch: king, emperor, etc.
  6. used as a title for or term of address to a high god, priest, male monarch, or high-ranking royal person.
  7. (of a royal person) (classifier องค์) head; headhair.

intj
  1. (perhaps influenced by English "God") an exclamation of alarm, surprise, disbelief, pleasure, etc.

noun

  2. (archaic) royal person who has been deprived of the rank of เจ้าฟ้า (jâao-fáa), พระองค์เจ้า (prá-ong-jâao), or หม่อมเจ้า (mɔ̀m-jâao) as punishment.
  3. (archaic) person whose father is a high-ranking public officer.

  5. (slang) female commoner who is a concubine of a royal person.

column1: แมสซาชูเซตส์|mɛ́t-saa-chuu-sèet

column2:
noun
  1. female parent, mother-in-law, or person regarded as a female parent.
  2. (chiefly in combination or as modifier) female parent of an animal.
  3. female head, chief, or leader; woman in charge; woman in authority.
  4. (slang) celebrated woman, trans woman, or effeminate man.
  5. body of water, as river, canal, etc.
  6. used as a term of address to or title for a female parent, mother-in-law, or person regarded as a female parent, and used by such person to refer to oneself.
  7. used as a term of address to or title for a woman in authority, goddess, or royal woman, and used by such person to refer to oneself.
  8. (slang) used as a term of address to or title for a celebrated woman, trans woman, or effeminate man, and used by such person to refer to oneself.
  9. used as a familiar or affectionate term of address to or title for a young or younger woman.
  10. used as a term of address to or title for any woman.
  11. used as a title for a body of water, as river, canal, etc.
  12. used as a modifier to indicate femininity.
  13. (irrespective of the sex) used as a modifier to indicate charge, leadership, supremacy, superiority, or principality.
  14. the category กก (gòk) for a syllable ended by the sound [k], which is represented by the letter ก (gɔɔ), ข (kɔ̌ɔ), ฃ (kɔ̌ɔ), ค (kɔɔ), ฅ (kɔɔ), or ฆ (kɔɔ);
  15. the category กง (gong) for a syllable ended by the sound [ŋ], which is represented by the letter ง (ngɔɔ);
  16. the category กด (gòt) for a syllable ended by the sound [t], which is represented by the letter จ (jɔɔ), ฉ (chɔ̌ɔ), ช (chɔɔ), ซ (sɔɔ), ฌ (chɔɔ), ฎ (dɔɔ), ฏ (dtɔɔ), ฐ (tɔ̌ɔ), ฑ (tɔɔ), ฒ (tɔɔ), ด (dɔɔ), ต (dtɔɔ), ถ (tɔ̌ɔ), ท (tɔɔ), ธ (tɔɔ), ศ (sɔ̌ɔ), ษ (sɔ̌ɔ), or ส (sɔ̌ɔ);
  17. the category กน (gon) for a syllable ended by the sound [n], which is represented by the letter ญ (yɔɔ), ณ (nɔɔ), น (nɔɔ), ร (rɔɔ), ล (lɔɔ), or ฬ (lɔɔ);
  18. the category กบ (gòp) for a syllable ended by the sound [p], which is represented by the letter บ (bɔɔ), ป (bpɔɔ), พ (pɔɔ), ฟ (fɔɔ), or ภ (pɔɔ);
  19. the category กม (gom) for a syllable ended by the sound [m], which is represented by the letter ม (mɔɔ);
  20. the category เกย (gəəi) for a syllable ended by the sound [j], which is represented by the letter ย (yɔɔ);
  21. the category เกอว (gəəo) for a syllable ended by the sound [w], which is represented by the letter ว (wɔɔ);
  22. the category ก กา (gɔɔ gaa) for an open syllable.

column2:
symbol
  1. An iteration mark named ยมก or ไม้ยมก denoting the repetition of the previous word or phrase.

character
  1. The diacritical mark called "mai ek" - ไม้เอก (mái-èek): it is the first of the Thai language's four tone marks. For the low initial consonant class (of syllables), the mai ek implies a falling tone. For the mid and the high initial consonant classes, the mai ek implies a low tone.

punct
  1. (typography, chiefly in old script) Thai punctuation mark marking the beginning of a new paragraph

punct
  1. (archaic) the punctuation mark marking the end of a passage.
